newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danish shares take a breather after record highs.
newsitem.headline: Danish shares take a breather after record highs.

text.p: Danish share prices opened lower on Wednesday, with dealers seeing a day or two of consolidation ahead after the recent period of solid advances with all-time KFX index closing highs.

"It looks like we are going to take a breather after the past two days' major advances. A falling U.S. market and political uncertainty in Denmark about the 1997 state budget also point to possible retrenchment," one dealer said.
The KFX top-20 index had fallen 0.48 point to 131.01 at 0840 gmt, after closing 1.30 point up on Tuesday at a new all-time closing record. --Copenhagen newsroom, 45-33-969650
